intro: Tylostylis rigida, commonly known as the rigid tylostylis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
